results.headline: The Union at the Polls

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Labor Day

results.summary_short: More than anything else, “Labor Day” is a slickly produced 76-minute commercial for the Service Employees International Union.

results.headline: Baby Sitter, Beware: That Top Step Is a Lulu

results.summary_short: “The House of the Devil” is a horror movie that provides more shiver than splatter.

results.headline: A Writer, a Snake and Bodily Waste

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gentlemen Broncos

results.summary_short: Timing, good jokes and characters you can laugh with and at are mostly missing from “Gentlemen Broncos.”

results.summary_short: “Boondock Saints II: All Saints Day” indulges in extreme movie love.

results.headline: The Pop Spectacular That Almost Was

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Michael Jackson's This Is It

results.summary_short: Death returned Michael Jackson’s humanity, and so does “Michael Jackson’s This Is It.”

results.headline: Taking Yet Another Hack at a Horror Franchise

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Saw VI

results.summary_short: The latest installment of the movie franchise is as customer-service-oriented as ever.

results.headline: Bodies in Motion

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wedding Song

results.summary_short: This seductively fluid and tactile drama explores love and identity through the prism of the female body and the rights of its owner.

results.headline: The Question: Is It Art? The Answer: Ambiguous

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Untitled

results.summary_short: Jonathan Parker’s acutely witty art-world satire carries off a tricky balancing act.

results.headline: Looking Low and Seeing Ghosts

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Stan Helsing

results.summary_short: This “Scary Movie” rip-off is an excuse to recycle every horror movie cliché since Lon Chaney Jr. grew a muzzle.

results.summary_short: “Ong Bak 2” is a sequel that bears virtually no connection to the original.

results.headline: Wandering in Paris, Woman to Woman

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Night and Day

results.summary_short: The South Korean director Hong Sang-soo unleashes yet another emotionally stunted antihero in “Night and Day.”

results.headline: Manhattan Mom, Burning Home Fires at Both Ends

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Motherhood

results.summary_short: You’ll need something to occupy your thoughts while watching this film, which seems to suffer from its heroine’s tendency toward distraction.

results.headline: Examining a Man Who Was (or Wasn’t?) a Holocaust Hero
results.display_title: Killing Kasztner: The Jew Who Dealt With Nazis

results.summary_short: Gaylen Ross’s methodical but overlong documentary pores over the life of Rudolf Kasztner, a leader of a Hungarian Jewish aid and rescue committee in World War II.

results.headline: There You Go, Rocket High Through the Sky, Trying to Accept Your Robot Self

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Astro Boy

results.summary_short: The strange, somewhat surreal cartoon robot called Astro Boy keeps aloft in a movie that can’t always do the same.

results.headline: In Satan’s Church, an Eden Besieged

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Antichrist

results.summary_short: Women: intrinsically evil or tragically misunderstood? If this strikes you as a fruitful topic of discussion, then you may wish to see — or perhaps I should say endure — Lars von Trier’s new film.

results.summary_short: Excesses of any pleasurable kind are absent from this exasperatingly dull production about Amelia Earhart.

results.headline: The Man Who Watched the Watchers

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rembrandt's J'Accuse

results.summary_short: “Rembrandt’s J’Accuse” is a generally absorbing if sometimes fog-inducing investigation into the mysteries of the Rembrandt painting “The Night Watch.”

results.headline: A Hindi Drama, With a Nod to Joan Crawford

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Main Aur Mrs Khanna

results.summary_short: The Hindi movie “Main Aur Mrs. Khanna” (“Me and Mrs. Khanna”) has romance and comedy but isn’t really a romantic comedy.
